0P00000JXR.F.manager_bio:
Marco Cecchi - Portfolio Manager
Joined: 2000 
Years in Investments: Since 2000
Marco Cecchi is a Portfolio Manager with the Fixed Income team at Pioneer Investment Management S.G.R.p.A. Marco relocated to the Milan investment centre from the Dublin office in 2004. Prior to his current role he worked for two and a half years in the Treasury Desk where he managed the FX exposure on International Bond Funds and cash management for various Pioneer Investmentsâ funds. 
Education / Experience
Marco joined Pioneer Investments in 2000 upon completion of a Masters specialising in Asset Management from Bocconi University and University College Dublin. Before beginning the Masters he worked briefly with IMI San Paolo in Milan. Marco is a Finance graduate of Bocconi University Milan.

0P0000TVGD.F.manager_bio:
George Philips, Senior Fund Manager, was the CIO and Co-Founder of Northwest Investment Management Ltd which was acquired by RAB Capital PLC at the beginning of September 2006. Prior to setting up Northwest (formerly Axis Capital) in 1998, George was a Partner at Caspian Securities (1996-1998) where he was Head of Convertible Securities and responsible for                                  Banking and proprietary activities. From 1988 to late 1993, George worked at Cresvale International Inc, New York, where he managed the marketing to US clients on an outright and hedged basis. In September 1989, he became the senior manager and Head of Basket Trading for Cresvale International Asset Management. Georgeâs career began in 1985 at James Capel & Co. in London: he combined roles of research and sales of corporate derivatives. He carried out research into the pricing and strategic uses of warrants and convertible bonds, such as synthesising equity, hedging and synthesising equity indices and puts. 
In 1988, George wrote the first book on the Japanese Warrant Market: âJapanese Warrants: Riding Bear as well as Bull Marketsâ (IFR Publishing Ltd). In 1992, George co-authored âJapanese Warrant marketsâ (Macmillan Publishing). In 1996, he wrote âConvertible Bond Marketsâ (Macmillan Publishing) which innovatively addressed subjects such as multivariate hedging and pricing of convertible securities, while incorporating more realistic assumptions. 
George was born in 1964 and graduated in 1985 from City London School of Business Studies, Guildhall University in London with a First Class Honours degree in Economics.

NMEBST.MI.long_name: New Millennium - Euro Bonds Short Term L
NMEBST.MI.summary: The Sub-Fund seeks a higher level of return than that usually achievable through money market instruments, while maintaining a low level of risk. The net assets of this SubâFund are invested in deposits, money market instruments, fixed and floating rate bonds denominated in Euro, issued mainly by Government and Supranational issuers. A potential investment in nonâinvestment grade or notârated securities is allowed, with an adequate diversification and with a limit of 5% of the net asset value.The average portfolio duration will be maintained at a low level.

NMHQB.MI.long_name: New Millennium - Augustum High Quality Bond L
NMHQB.MI.summary: The Sub-Fund seeks to maintain a stable trend in performance, while aiming to obtain a higher level of return than are usually achievable through money market instruments and at the same time keeping risk levels low.
